item.description:
The summer solstice marks the longest day of the year because the sun is at its most northern point in the sky. In Shin, light symbolizes understanding of our true nature; it is the simultaneuous awakening to our inner darkness and the all accepting Great Compassion that embraces us.  

  

Come and join us for renewal and hope. The Beginning Anew ceremony is a powerful and intensely emotional experience. It allows the participants to look deeply within, share their feelings about others or events, and to let go of personal obstacles in order to awaken to peace and harmony. There will be 4 main phases: 1) mindful incense offering, 2) sharing regrets, 3) expressing hurt, 4) sharing a difficulty & asking for support. Sharing is purely voluntary but listening is equally a powerful experience. After each phase, a short meditation and loving kindness prayer will be given the participants. This special community practice is conducted only twice a year. Lead by Senpai Sensei.

 

For more information and direction, visit the Buddhist Faith Fellowship at www.bffct.net
